pt: {sc}fault{/sc} {sc}failing{/sc} {sc}frailty{/sc} {sc}foible{/sc} {sc}vice{/sc} mean an imperfection or weakness of character. {sc}fault{/sc} implies a failure, not necessarily culpable, to reach some standard of perfection in disposition, action, or habit.

pt.t: a writer of many virtues and few {it}faults{/it}

pt: {sc}failing{/sc} suggests a minor shortcoming in character.

pt.t: being late is a {it}failing{/it} of mine

pt: {sc}frailty{/sc} implies a general or chronic proneness to yield to temptation.
{sc}foible{/sc} applies to a harmless or endearing weakness or idiosyncrasy.
{sc}vice{/sc} can be a general term for any imperfection or weakness, but it often suggests violation of a moral code or the giving of offense to the moral sensibilities of others.
